Package com.accele.gage.state

Class GameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.accele.gage.state.GameState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cleanable, Indexable, Renderable, Tickable
    public abstract class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
implements Indexable, Tickable, Renderable, Cleanable
    The parent class for all states in the engine.

    GAGE is a state-based engine, so all actions are performed in different instances of the GameState class. States are intended to be used for different parts of the target application. For instance, the main menu of an application would require one state and the gameplay would require another state.

    States must be registered before they can be used via getStateRegistry(). Once registered, they can be set using any variation of setCurrentState(). GAGE requires an instance of GameState to be set as the current state of the engine. If a state is not set before starting the engine, GAGE will throw an exception, saying that there is no GameState loaded in the current context.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    William Garland

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public abstract void init()
        Called when setting the current state to initialize this GameState.

        If this GameState is the new state that is being set, this method will only be called if either setCurrentState(String) was called or setCurrentState(String, boolean, boolean) was called with initNew set to true.

      • exit

        public abstract void exit()
        Called when setting the current state to finalize this GameState.

        If this GameState was already set as the current state, this method will only be called if either setCurrentState(String) was called or setCurrentState(String, boolean, boolean) was called with exitOld set to true.

      • getRegistryId

        public java.lang.String getRegistryId()
        Description copied from interface: Indexable
        Returns the registry ID to use in the Registry. This ID must be unique within the registry.
        Specified by:
        getRegistryId in interface Indexable
        Returns:
        the registry ID to use in the Registry
